alert.note: Alert for Debeque to Silt Corridor; Grand and Battlement Mesas (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 25 at 12:39PM MDT until further notice by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Grand Junction CO has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Colorado... Plateau Creek near Cameo affecting Grand and Battlement Mesas and Debeque to Silt Corridor. .Warm temperatures will continue to melt snowpack and increase river flows. In addition, Vega Reservoir is expected to reach full capacity, utilizing the overflow spillway, which will increase flow down Plateau Creek.
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Residents and those recreating along or near the creek should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. COZ007-009-271845- /O.NEW.KGJT.FL.A.0004.230525T1839Z-000000T0000Z/ /PCCC2.0.MC.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.NR/ 1239 PM MDT Thu May 25 2023 ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Plateau Creek from Collbran to the confluence with the Colorado River near Cameo. * WHEN...From this afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 7.5 feet, some lowland flooding can be expected along Route 65. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM MDT Thursday the stage was 6.1 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached based on the latest forecast information. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood

area.areaDesc: Debeque to Silt Corridor; Grand and Battlement Mesas
